name: 1. Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the Subcontractor’s copy. Current revision to be obtained via Aconex.
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers on Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and surveyed (marked on site). Limits of work clearly defined.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - At least 2 weeks prior to application on site
Acceptance Criteria - Details of proposed Rubberised Bituminous Bandage (RBB) sealant product including manufacturer’s data sheet and recommendations for application to be submitted for approval.
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - RBB must be a proprietary polymer modified bitumen (PMB) crack and joint bandage product and be suitable for climate conditions of the site. RBB to have following properties:
– Flow at 60°C at 5 hours to be maximum 5mm

Acceptance Criteria - Cracks, joints and all other locations to be sealed must be sufficiently cleaned and dried out prior to sealing. All wide (greater than 8mm) and/or deep cracks in all types of pavement must be choked with dry sand to not less than 10mm below the surface of the pavement.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to continuing with crack sealing works
Acceptance Criteria - A 50m length of RBB to be applied at location agreed with Principal’s Design Consultant for inspection and approval.
Acceptance Criteria - Sealant bandage must be within 50 to 75mm wide with the thickness not exceeding 1.5mm unless otherwise noted on drawings.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Installed sealant must be protected from damage by traffic (and possible pick up on construction vehicles and aircraft tyres) until it has cooled to ambient temperature.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Any sealant split on surface of pavements must be cleaned off immediately.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - At completion of each work
Acceptance Criteria - Each lot package must include the following:
– Product used including the batch number
– Date and start and finish times
– Weather conditions including range of air temperature
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
